intro: Cnesmone peltata, commonly known as the broadleaf cnesmone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
